text: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs!
The first computer virus was created in 1983 and was called the 'Elk Cloner'.
The first programmer in history was a woman named Ada Lovelace, who wrote the first algorithm for Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine in the 1840s.
The first website ever created is still online! You can visit it at info.cern.ch.
A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks, 'Can I join you?'
The term 'bug' to describe a computer glitch originated in 1947 when Grace Hopper found a moth causing problems in the Harvard Mark II computer.
JavaScript was created in just 10 days by Brendan Eich in 1995.
The average webpage size in 1995 was 14KB. Today, it's over 2MB!
Why do Java developers wear glasses? Because they don't C#!
The first computer mouse was made of wood and invented by Doug Engelbart in 1964.
There are approximately 700 programming languages in use today.
The most expensive domain name ever sold was Cars.com for $872 million.
There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary and those who don't.
The first tweet was sent by Jack Dorsey on March 21, 2006. It said 'just setting up my twttr'.
The most popular programming language, JavaScript, was originally developed in just 10 days.
